programme.title: What We Know with Max Foster
programme.desc: Max Foster has a definitive roundup of the days top stories, giving you the urgent need-to-know context, plus a deeper dive into the questions sparking debate around the world.

programme.title: Quest Means Business
programme.desc: Hes not messing around: Richard Quest presents his hot takes on the biggest breaking stories in the world of business. Watch for the expert analysis, commentary and opinions on the important headlines in the field from the notorious English journalist and CNN anchor. Joined by a cast of experts and correspondents delivering unrivaled facts and news, but also features and fascinating takes, figures and analysis on everything going down in the world of business.

programme.title: World Sport
programme.desc: One of the CNNs longest running programmes that allows viewers to find out all the global sports news, see all the important events and most interesting parts, and enjoy the interviews with sports pundits and various sports stars.

programme.title: The Brief with Jim Sciutto
programme.desc: The best of CNNs reporting from correspondents across the world, to guide global audiences through the fast-paced news cycle with insight, analysis and hard-hitting interviews.

programme.title: Erin Burnett OutFront
programme.desc: Hosted by Erin Burnett, an expert in political science and economics, OutFront is an hour-long news programme examining the latest stories from the US and further afield. Broadcast live from either the New York studio or live on location from the site of a breaking story, the show features insightful opinions from informed guests. With expert analysis from CNNs correspondents and analysis from the shows panel, Erin Burnett OutFront dissects the stories of the day, leaving no stone unturned. Burnett, a former financial analyst for Goldman Sachs, uses her forthright approach to engage interviewees in honest discussion.

programme.title: Anderson Cooper
programme.desc: Anderson Cooper delves into the days news, looking beyond the broadcast to give his take, prompting us to re-think what we hear in the headlines. Cooper has covered major, international stories like the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina on the Gulf Coast, the catastrophic BP oil spill and the 2010 earthquake in Haiti, which saw the whole world fall silent. The show has won an absolute plethora of awards over the years, including GLAAD Media and Emmy awards.

programme.title: The Source with Kaitlan Collins
programme.desc: Kaitlan Collins goes straight to the source for the best reporting on the days biggest stories.

programme.title: CNN NewsNight
programme.desc: Magazino. Current affairs show with Abby Phillip.

programme.title: Laura Coates Live
programme.desc: Magazino. Current affairs show.

programme.title: The Story Is: With Elex Michaelson
programme.desc: Elex Michaelson tackles the breaking stories making headlines with sharp analysis, fresh perspective, and a dose of humor.

programme.title: CNN Newsroom
programme.desc: CNN Newroom provides the most up to date news as it breaks and is the longest running show on the channel, airing twice a day Monday to Friday and throughout the day over the weekends. CNN has developed a lot since its founding in 1980 by American media proprietor Ted Turner as a 24 hour cable news channel. As an organisation, CNN have won multiple awards, including a network-record six news and documentary Emmy Awards in 2018.

programme.title: CNN Newsroom

programme.title: Amanpour
programme.desc: Global affairs programme in which host Christiane Amanpour analyses some of the most relevant stories from around the world, often adding her personal experiences. She also interviews a variety of notable, high-profile people and key players from various fields.

programme.title: Early Start with Rahel Solomon
programme.desc: Magazino. Start your day with all the information you need. This hour gives you the stories that will shape the next 24. On the agenda: U.S. politics and global affairs, what to expect in the business world, and key cultural and sporting events.

programme.title: CNN This Morning
programme.desc: The latest news and information from around the world. Don Lemon, Poppy Harlow, and Kaitlan Collins host.

programme.title: CNN News Central
programme.desc: News. The core hub of the networks best newsgathering operation during the day, bringing stories to viewers in real time, while offering perspective and context to key issues using innovative technology and storytelling tools.

programme.title: World Sport
programme.desc: One of the CNNs longest running programmes that allows viewers to find out all the global sports news, see all the important events and most interesting parts, and enjoy the interviews with sports pundits and various sports stars.

programme.title: Connect the World
programme.desc: Join high profile news anchor Becky Anderson live from Abu Dhabi as she brings you all the latest news from around the world . CNN has developed a lot since its founding in 1980 by American media proprietor Ted Turner as a 24 hour cable news channel. As an organisation, CNN have won multiple awards, including a network-record six news and documentary Emmy Awards in 2018.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: This reality TV show follows Marty Raney and his two children, Matt Raney and Misty Bilodeau, who are successful homesteaders from the state of Alaska and have the skills needed to fish, hunt, raise livestock, and otherwise survive in an untamed landscape. Struggling homesteaders across the country call these experts to help them save their homesteads and become self-sufficient while they teach them the necessary skills to survive the wilderness.

programme.title: Harpoon Hunters
programme.desc: As Joe and Tyler fight for the top spot, dark horse Niko tries to steal it. But everything comes down to the final weigh-ins at the dock.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: American reality series is about Alaskan pioneers Yule and Ruth Kilcher and their kids living together at their homestead. The Kilchers demonstrate one-of-a-kind model of surviving in severe conditions of the last frontier. Enjoy amazing panorama views of Alaska, showing its various nature. Sitting in a comfortable chair in your warm apartment just try to imagine how it really is when electricity and running water is not inevitable fact of life. The Kilchers hunt, go fishing, garden, gather, raise livestock in order to survive Alaskas uncontrollable power and wilderness.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland travel across the United Kingdom to uncover classic cars to buy, restore and sell on for a profit. The pair scour garages, barns and facilities to discover collectible cars which include the likes of the Morris Minor Traveller, Jaguar XJS, Rover P6 and a BMW 635 CSI among many others. The combination of Drews expertise of negotiation and deal-making and Pauls extensive mechanical knowledge makes them a formidable team ready to tackle anything challenging that comes their way.

programme.title: Misfit Garage
programme.desc: Misfit Garage is a reality TV show, a spin off from Fast N Loud. It features two of the mechanics fired from that shows Dallas, Texas-based Gas Monkey Garage, Tom Smith and Jordan Butler, as well as Thomas Weeks and Scot McMillan, who together start a new company, Fired Up Garage. The crew run into former co-workers of the shop they were all fired from by Richard Rawlings and who they later find out is their new shop landlord. It takes a lot of courage to face the problems from the past and deal with the challenging present, but this is exactly what the guys do.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: This reality TV show follows Marty Raney and his two children, Matt Raney and Misty Bilodeau, who are successful homesteaders from the state of Alaska and have the skills needed to fish, hunt, raise livestock, and otherwise survive in an untamed landscape. Struggling homesteaders across the country call these experts to help them save their homesteads and become self-sufficient while they teach them the necessary skills to survive the wilderness.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Buy, repair and restore and then resell a classic car in order to make profit- this is what Wheeler Dealers is about. The budget is limited, though you can see some exclusive and rare cars. Mike Brewer, a British dealer chooses the car carefully and hands it over to the mechanic, first Edd China, later Ant Anstead to be fixed and upgraded. The hosts are real masters of their trade, it seems they can bring life even to a piece of metal. It does not matter if you are a life-long car enthusiast or do not even have a driving license you will admire the results of hard work from the beginning to the end of the long uneasy restoring process.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how things that surround us every day are produced? Find out about the whole process from the beginning to the end in a documentary television series How Its Made. The series demonstrates how various items like clothing and accessories, food, industrial products, cars, musical instruments and many more are manufactured. Who would have thought how exciting it would be to watch a cupcake, formula 1 race car or gummy vitamins being made?

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How Do They Do It? Ever wondered how the stripes get into toothpaste or how contact lenses are made? How do goods get from one country to another and then into our supermarkets? What are car tires made from and exactly why are plasma TV screens flat? Eating, drinking, driving, flying. These all are activities that we carry out with barely a second thought. But have you ever wondered what exactly goes into your teabag and how it got there? How does an airport handle hundreds of thousands of items of luggage each day? And just how can a cars airbag inflate so quickly? Every day – often without even realizing it – we come into contact with technology, be it in the bathroom, in the car or on the golf course. We take a look at how things work, and focus on some of the most amazing examples of everyday objects including the worlds fastest elevator and the most expensive chocolate money can buy.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Expert craftsmen are bringing Drew Pritchards finds back to life and restore them to their former glory. Drew hunts for treasures such as derelict gems and forgotten remnants across the country. And then he and his team do the restoration turning trash to gold, so that worn objects become shining gems for which Drews customers want to pay a lot of money. All kinds of items can and will be restored, starting from a century-old suitcase to an ancient coffee machine, from a ravaged carousel horse to a large railway clock.

programme.title: Insane Pools Off the Deep End
programme.desc: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End is a home improvement show that follows pool designer Lucas Congdon and his team from Lucas Lagoons. Congdon and his crew renovate existing pools and build new ones on residential properties. Thanks to their unbelievable imagination, creativity and professionalism they can turn every pool into an ultimate backyard oasis for a whole family and transform it into a natural lagoon. They prefer working with hand-selected stones from Tennessee.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Buy, repair and restore and then resell a classic car in order to make profit- this is what Wheeler Dealers is about. The budget is limited, though you can see some exclusive and rare cars. Mike Brewer, a British dealer chooses the car carefully and hands it over to the mechanic, first Edd China, later Ant Anstead to be fixed and upgraded. The hosts are real masters of their trade, it seems they can bring life even to a piece of metal. It does not matter if you are a life-long car enthusiast or do not even have a driving license you will admire the results of hard work from the beginning to the end of the long uneasy restoring process.

programme.title: Bitchin Rides
programme.desc: Bitchin Rides is a reality styled TV show hosted by Dave Kindig from the Salt Lake City, Utah-based company Kindig It Designs. Daves real passion is designing and building custom cars. We watch the process of restoring and rebuilding all types and all periods of cars. In each episode Dave and his team review a car, create a design, then the team takes it apart and rebuilds to create a one-of-a-kind gem. Things get really ugly before they get pretty. Dave has the best team of top mechanics, technicians and fabricators in the business, quality is their only focus when they create the baddest bitchin rides.

programme.title: Three Men Four Wheels
programme.desc: Follow three friends and car enthusiasts - car dealer Drew Pritchard, motoring broadcaster Andy Jaye, and racing driver Marino Franchitti, as they set out to discover the greatest racing cars ever made. In each episode, one of them chooses the car - Ferrari F40, Lotus 72, Aston Martin Ulster, Porsche 911 ST, Jaguar XJ220,... then the guys learn more about the vehicle, meet some people who love it, and drive it.

programme.title: Three Men Four Wheels
programme.desc: Follow three friends and car enthusiasts - car dealer Drew Pritchard, motoring broadcaster Andy Jaye, and racing driver Marino Franchitti, as they set out to discover the greatest racing cars ever made. In each episode, one of them chooses the car - Ferrari F40, Lotus 72, Aston Martin Ulster, Porsche 911 ST, Jaguar XJ220,... then the guys learn more about the vehicle, meet some people who love it, and drive it.

programme.title: Mighty Truckers
programme.desc: This real-life road show follows the lives of twenty truckers from four different countries - Poland, Italy, Germany and the Netherlands. These unique and diverse characters will show the viewers the world of transport, introducing them with the profession of "truck driver". Who are these men and women who ensure that we get various goods on time day and night? What makes them choose the life on the road? This show will answer these questions in an "up close and personal" portrait of trucker life.

programme.title: Survival instinct
programme.desc: Each week, a new pair of total strangers are faced with the ultimate survival challenge: survive for 21 days together with no clothes or supplies in some of the most dangerous environments in the world. In addition to the landscape itself working against the duo, the local wildlife stalk them as well. Of course, the biggest complication for any of the couples might end up being their own clashing egos. Will they make it out alive, or will they fall victim to the wilderness? They must fall back on their most primal instincts to ensure they dont become prey themselves.

programme.title: Garage Rehab
programme.desc: American petrol head and reality TV star, Richard Rawlings, famous for his show Fast N Loud, visits struggling garages and car workshops that are desperate for a helping hand. Alongside the team of world-class mechanics from his Gas Monkey Garage, Richard invests his precious time and money to get these toiling businesses back where they belong. The team visit workshops all over the USA, using their knowledge and experience to rev up the old girls and get their engines purring once more. With a serious amount of elbow grease on top of the help from Richards team, the owners have a shot once more at a successful business.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: As the modern world becomes progressively automated and mechanised its easy to become detached from how things are made and how they work. The hit series returns to uncover the miraculous feats of engineering which underpin life in the 21st century. How the seemingly mundane are often the result of highly sophisticated engineering and production processes. This fascinating behind-the-scenes journey delves deep into the production of everyday modern items from surfboards to satchels and trombones to cricket bats.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how things that surround us every day are produced? Find out about the whole process from the beginning to the end in a documentary television series How Its Made. The series demonstrates how various items like clothing and accessories, food, industrial products, cars, musical instruments and many more are manufactured. programme.title: Misfit Garage

programme.title: Body Cam
programme.desc: Documentary series following police officers across the USA as they put their lives on the line to enforce the law. Using real footage from the officers body cameras, we show just how deadly routine checks can be, with law enforcement officials having to think on their feet and make split-second decisions to potentially save their, or someone elses, life. From knife-wielding maniacs to brutal shootouts, the series highlights the importance of our police departments. With interviews from the officers involved adding context to the footage, Body Cam Cops gives viewers unprecedented, exclusive access to what life is truly like in the line of duty.

programme.title: Late Night Lockup
programme.desc: An officer tries to stop a speeding car in Wisconsin, but it crashes into a police vehicle. At Dallas airport, police deal with an unruly passenger.

programme.title: Late Night Lockup
programme.desc: In Mayfield, Ohio, a patrol officer performs a traffic stop after spotting an erratic driver. In Wisconsin, a cop spots a potential drug dealer.

programme.title: High Speed Chase
programme.desc: A driver in a stolen vehicle leads a rookie cop on an action-packed pursuit in Florida. In Illinois, cops chase down a convicted murderer.

programme.title: Asphalt Cowboys
programme.desc: Hauling a heavy load in gigantic trucks is no joke, and this reality series follows truckers, also known as asphalt cowboys, as they earn their money transporting heavy goods across the European continent. Battling the elements, strict time constraints, and the loneliness of being away from home, these truckers fire up their engines and waste no time on the road, ensuring their clients goods arrive on time and in one piece!

programme.title: Asphalt Cowboys
programme.desc: Hauling a heavy load in gigantic trucks is no joke, and this reality series follows truckers, also known as asphalt cowboys, as they earn their money transporting heavy goods across the European continent. Battling the elements, strict time constraints, and the loneliness of being away from home, these truckers fire up their engines and waste no time on the road, ensuring their clients goods arrive on time and in one piece!

programme.title: Overhaulin
programme.desc: Overhaulin is an American reality TV series about customizing cars. The main difference from the other shows of this type is detailed presentation of the technical process and import scene plus serious-minded approach to the car owners needs. The hosts are Chip Foose and Chris Jacobs. The concept of the series is that the car owner is absolutely unaware of whats going on. His car disappears one day and the owner is convinced that it has been stolen, misplaced or lost at a mechanics shop, or has been towed away by police. Chip Foose and a team of mechanics have a week to remake the car into a custom masterpiece. Each show ends up with the surprise reuniting of the owner and his customized baby on four wheels.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: Mike Whiteside and Robert Kulp are the hosts of Salvage Dawgs show that is about saving beautiful old things from buildings planned to be torn down. They and their talented crew teach the viewers how to repurpose old stuff into something new and useful instead of throwing it away. So if you are remodeling your home think twice before you get rid of anything. Get creative, have some fun and learn tips and tricks to help you build your skills. Learn how to transform old chairs into a functional bench, how to repurpose an old paneled door into a shelf and enjoy fantastic vintage pieces from the past.

programme.desc: Mike Whiteside and Robert Kulp are the hosts of Salvage Dawgs show that is about saving beautiful old things from buildings planned to be torn down. They and their talented crew teach the viewers how to repurpose old stuff into something new and useful instead of throwing it away. So if you are remodeling your home think twice before you get rid of anything. Get creative, have some fun and learn tips and tricks to help you build your skills. Learn how to transform old chairs into a functional bench, how to repurpose an old paneled door into a shelf and enjoy fantastic vintage pieces from the past.

programme.title: Marooned with Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Adrenaline-filled documentary series in which Ed Stafford, British explorer and adventurer, travels to remote destinations and some of the worlds toughest environments to see if he can survive there on his own, without even essential equipment such as clothes, food, and tools. He can only take his camera, an emergency satellite phone and an emergency medical kit. Staffords goal is to see if he can not only survive, but prosper under these extreme conditions, pushing his body and mind to the limit.

programme.title: Dude, Youre Screwed
programme.desc: Unique, adrenaline-filled docu-reality series that follows five unprepared survivalists who are dropped into some of the worlds harshest environments, and they must make their way back to civilisation within 100 hours. Meet Green Beret Terry Schappert, primitive survival expert Matt Graham, former Navy SEAL Jake Zweig, Army veteran Tom Moore and RAF survival expert John Hudson. In each episode, one of them is captured by surprise, blindfolded and dropped to some remote location around the world by his fellow survivalists. He has 100 hours to find his way back, using only the survival kit that contains some useful, but also some more unusual items. Participant wears a biometric belt, which allows the team to determine if he gets into a critical condition, and if that happens he is disqualified and automatically loses the game.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: American reality series is about Alaskan pioneers Yule and Ruth Kilcher and their kids living together at their homestead. The Kilchers demonstrate one-of-a-kind model of surviving in severe conditions of the last frontier. Enjoy amazing panorama views of Alaska, showing its various nature. Sitting in a comfortable chair in your warm apartment just try to imagine how it really is when electricity and running water is not inevitable fact of life. The Kilchers hunt, go fishing, garden, gather, raise livestock in order to survive Alaskas uncontrollable power and wilderness.

programme.title: Expedition Files
programme.desc: Josh Gates investigates an expedition crewed by cannibals, the obsessive search for a hidden city, and the murder of an aspiring young actress.

programme.title: Expedition Files
programme.desc: New information reveals Jack the Rippers identity. DNA suggests the existence of a Yeti. Max Headroom hijacks a live broadcast, shocking the world.

programme.title: Mystery Of Blind Frog Ranch
programme.desc: Locals say that Bling Frog Ranch in Utah is a cursed land, a place that should not been interfered with, a place where strange things just seem to happen. Rumours have long circulated about a lost treasure hidden somewhere on the ranch, and that the mysterious land is trying to hold on to something. This reality series follows Duane Ollinger as he throws everything he has at finding its hidden treasures, but every time he thinks he close, another peculiar incident arises.

programme.title: Survival instinct
programme.desc: Each week, a new pair of total strangers are faced with the ultimate survival challenge: survive for 21 days together with no clothes or supplies in some of the most dangerous environments in the world. In addition to the landscape itself working against the duo, the local wildlife stalk them as well. Of course, the biggest complication for any of the couples might end up being their own clashing egos. Will they make it out alive, or will they fall victim to the wilderness? They must fall back on their most primal instincts to ensure they dont become prey themselves.

programme.title: Survival instinct

programme.title: Scrappers
programme.desc: Meet the colourful characters that work in Polands scrap metal industry. Plus, a behind the scenes view of where the materials come from and where they go after the scrapyard.

programme.title: Expedition Files

programme.title: Expedition Files

programme.title: Speed Kills
programme.desc: Desert creatures endure searing heat and zero rainfall, but speed is their ticket to survival.A Tiger beetle runs at the human equivalent of 500 miles per hour. A caracal jumps six feet to swat a weaverbird out of midair. And the worlds fastest chameleon hunts on the desert floor.Only the hardiest, fastest animals survive. Nothing else stands a chance.

programme.title: Africas Deadliest
programme.desc: A national Geographic documentary looking into the deadliest animals that roam Africa. Examining animals that have evolved complex weapons from teeth to claws and agility so that they can protect themselves and battle effectively. From elephant tusks that can defend or attack to the fur, speed and agility of seals. Showing how these animals have exceptional skills and power alongside their body features that have developed into ideal tools for their needs.

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Fanged Spiders with their scurrying bites. The Scorpion with its deadly sting... A sinister cold bloodied crocodile. The hypnotizing venomous snake. Or the King of Beasts, the Lion? Which one is the most dangerous? LION Giraffes are eternally majestic, buffalo formidable, but with their golden fur, regal mane and fearsome presence lions are known as the "King of Beasts" SCORPIONS A barely habitable burnt corner of the earth, parched and sun drenched... Once the sun has set and temperatures drop, the night time wilderness becomes a very dangerous place. SPIDERS With long legs that weave inescapable snares, spiderlings that hatch in their hundreds….and fangs that inject lethal venom into their prey, spiders strike fear into many people. In Greek mythology the great weaving god Arachne, was turned into the first spider, while in Japanese mythology shape shifting demons often take a spider-like form. SNAKES Snakes have fascinated and terrified humans for thousands of years. In many parts of the world they are worshipped as protectors and creators. But some cultures fear snakes as devils and symbols of vengeance and death. CROCODILE Lurking in the worlds rivers, marshes and swamps lie

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: Camouflaged cats. Some animals will never be inconspicuous, others blend so perfectly with their surroundings that they can move through them without detection. For many of the cats of Africa, camouflage is key to survival. From the spots of the cheetah, the rosettes of the leopard and the stripes and dots of the serval, these cats have evolved to merge with their habitat. Hidden lizards. Feeding on these harvester ants, is a beautifully adapted predator, the regal horned lizard. Merging perfectly with their surroundings these small reptiles live in the rocky, gravelly, desert like habitats of Arizona where they make a living almost exclusively on ants. Cryptic snakes. In the leaf litter of Australias woodlands and scrub hides one of its most cryptic and dangerous snakes – the death adder. The camouflaging patterns of snakes are mesmerizing – from the pearly multicolored sheen of the carpet python to the mottled bands of the death adder, snakes can be hidden right before our eyes. Shimmering cuttlefish . Many animals can hide and many can disguise themselves to some degree, but few can rival the camouflaging capabilities of the magnificent cuttlefish. Cuttlefish can not only change color, they can also change their shape as well as their texture as they morph through seamless variations of themselves.…. and concealed chameleons. Making camouflage an art form are the verdant sauntering highly distinctive chameleons that make their homes in rain forests, grasses, trees and bushes. There are well over 100 species of chameleon around today, ranging from the tiny pygmy chameleon to the prehistoric looking horned chameleon, most are found in Africa and Madagascar. Birds. In the frozen climbs of the northern hemisphere winter, ptarmigans blend against their snowy surroundings. Invisible spiders - Crab Spider. There is one tiny creature that has evolved a camouflage that is so perfect in its simplicity it is often overlooked by the casual human observer. Adapted to their hunting terrain the crab spiders that are found on bark and leaves are darker in coloration than those found on flowers which is the master of disguise?

programme.title: Blue Realm
programme.desc: Around the globe, thousands of decommissioned naval vessels rot in dockyards. What can you do with these toxic time bombs? One solution is to clean them well, blow them up and sink them! Providing shelter and breeding grounds, countless fish and invertebrates colonize steel hulls. In the Cayman Islands, the USS Kittiwake met a watery grave and quickly transformed into a vibrant artificial reef. In the Florida Keys, dozens of purposely sunk ships are a beacon to marine life, and to scuba divers. It seems like a win-win-win situation - for the environment, for divers and for cash strapped governments. But supporters face tough opposition on many fronts. After years of struggle, Canadas newest artificial reef project - the HMCS Annapolis, is nearing completion. But will protesters get their way and scuttle the sinking?

programme.title: Blue Realm
programme.desc: Theres no doubt sharks have an image problem. And theyre certainly in trouble globally. The population of some species has declined by more than 90% due to over fishing. But theres still one place in the world where sharks thrive - the Bahamas. Sharks not only prosper there, they are highly protected. Its illegal to kill them. Stuart Coves passion is sharks. Travelling In his private plane, he spreads the gospel of shark advocacy across the Bahamian island chain. And shark tourism is his livelihood. A successful entrepreneur, his main business revolves around scuba diving with sharks. Cove also works with Bahamian and international researchers in their studies of dangerous species such as tiger, hammerhead and bull sharks.

programme.title: Blue Realm
programme.desc: Filmed using crystal clear High Definition technology, The Blue Realm takes the viewer on a fascinating and breath-taking journey of discovery beneath the waves to examine the unique biology and extraordinary behaviour of undersea animals. Filmed by expert divers with a passion for marine life and environment, the compelling stories and captivating creatures come from many locations around the world including Papua New Guinea, Palau, South Africa, the Red Sea, the Great Barrier Reef, the Bahamas, Cocos Island, British Columbia, Texas, Indonesia, the Socorro Archipelago, California and Florida.

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: The most venomous snake on land. The deserted heart of the Australian outback, where people seldom venture, is the hot, baked home of the most venomous land snake in the world - the inland taipan, a two meter long snake with enough venom in one bite to kill a quarter of a million mice. The rare envenomating lizard. Venom is not the exclusive domain of snakes and spiders. In the deserts of the south-west United States and the north west of Mexico lives the striking and venomous Gila Monster - the largest land lizard in North America. Blue ringed octopus. In the shallow waters of the Pacific Ocean is an animal the size of a golf ball that carries with it not one, but two types of venom. One is used on its main prey of crabs and is relatively harmless to humans, the other is used in defense and can kill an adult human in minutes. The tiny toxin wielding Red-backed spider. In secluded outhouses, under fences and letterboxes, under barbeques and amongst garden litter are the messy webs that hold the killing fields and the hundreds of offspring of a very deadly female. Tucked in the corner of her web the scarlet stripe of the red-back spider advertises her lethal capabilities. The feroci

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. At the heart of Africa, the Congo for many people will always be associated with Joseph Conrads early twentieth-century novel the Heart of Darkness, a title that has become a by-word for the country. And for Benjamin and David, two former child soldiers, and Funaha held as a sex slave by one of the many militias that continue to terrorise the country, that metaphor remains a daily reality. The film explores how this seemingly never-ending conflict impacts on the people of North Kivu.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: Music Voyager is a music and travel broadcast series (television/cable, broadband, in-flight and mobile) that invites viewers to discover the exciting sounds of the planet. The host is Jacob Edgar, an explorer who does not search for lost cities or ancient ruins. Hes on the quest for a different kind of treasure…music. As an ethnomusicologist and world music record producer, Edgar travels the globe hunting for the best songs the world has to offer, and he suffers through some of the worst…so you dont have to. Along the way, hes rewarded with a backstage pass to concert halls, street festivals, recording studios and rehearsal rooms. With local musicians as his guide, Edgar tastes exotic and occasionally ghastly food, visits off-the-beaten path attractions and parties the night away to amazing concerts at hidden venues that only the locals know. Join music voyager for unexpected adventures and surprising discoveries that unveil the magic, mystery and music of far off lands.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: What stories lay buried beneath the surface, waiting to be revealed? 200 years on from Raffles landing, archaeologists are digging deep and unearthing new artefacts that reshape what we think we know about Singapore. From uncovering evidence of an ancient settlement, to discovering forgotten relics from the lives of people in colonial Singapore and World War 2, they are piecing together new evidence that will paint a story of Singapore over seven centuries. In this three-episode series, teams of archaeologists will look to the land and seas for clues to seek out these lost chapters of history that are forgotten by time, only to be uncovered today.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: Derek Acorahs The Past Hunters continue their investigation of Weir Mill and the search for paranormal activity takes a darker turn. Will they finally uncover the truth behind the buildings dark hauntings?

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: The R.I.P. Files features a group of paranormal investigators, who use intuitive abilities and a deep knowledge of metaphysical techniques to interact with the entities they encounter at haunted locations. They encourage the spirits to share their stories in their own words through amazing EVPs and other evidence that is bridging the gap between the worlds of science and spirituality.

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: The R.I.P. Files features a group of paranormal investigators, who use intuitive abilities and a deep knowledge of metaphysical techniques to interact with the entities they encounter at haunted locations. They encourage the spirits to share their stories in their own words through amazing EVPs and other evidence that is bridging the gap between the worlds of science and spirituality.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: Go for launch! We visit Space Shuttle Endeavor at the California Science Center. Then, we check out the glitch and glamour at the Hollywood Museum. Well learn about the Holocaust at the Holocaust Museum and Japanese Internment during WWII at the Japanese/American National Museum. After that, we dig for bones at the famous La Brea Tar Pits.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: Gold, ivory and slaves drove the economy of the East coast of Africa 500 years ago. Join us as we explore the Portuguese and Arab roles in these horrific trade schemes. Well also investigate the pristine waters off the coast of the nearby National Park where our host dons a snorkel mask and comes face-to-face with the creatures of the coral reef.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: The Great Rift Valley is actually where the continent of Africa is literally tearing itself apart. Its a geologic phenomenon where one side is a rainforest full of colorful birds and strange monkeys and the other, a large lake centered on a vast plain. Two bordering eco-zones…double the wildlife.

programme.title: Everyday Elements
programme.desc: A series that puts chemistry in our everyday experience by showing the living connection we have with the chemicals and elements that make up our world. The matter that built skies and seas, the atoms that make up you and me, the chemistry around us that forms the things we touch, smell and see. This series shows us what the objects in our universe and in our homes are made from and why the particles around us behave as they do. Everything around us is built from Everyday Elements.

programme.title: Everyday Elements
programme.desc: A series that puts chemistry in our everyday experience by showing the living connection we have with the chemicals and elements that make up our world. programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: Were headed upstate to Albany and Saratoga Springs. Well take the Albany capital tour and see five former NY governors who would become US Presidents. Then, well board the USS Slater and see how America defended its fleet against German U-boats in WWII. Well sample the mineral water in Saratoga Springs, and bet the farm at their famous thoroughbred raceway. Then, well learn how important the Battle of Saratoga was for Americas future at Saratoga battlefield.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: We travel to the end of the rainbow in Dublin, Ireland. Well gawk at the Book of Kells, a holy book displayed at Trinity College. We visited the hallowed halls of St. Patricks Cathedral, and touched famed Irishman, Daniel OConnells crypt at Glasnevin Cemetery. Finally, we learn the complicated history of Irish independence at Kilmainham jail.

programme.title: Out Of Town Adventures
programme.desc: Outta Town Adventures travels both near and far to discover the best advenures the destinations have to offer. Season 1 visits attractions from California to Rwanda, Switzerland, Iceland, Utah, Zambia, Mexico, The Grand Canyon, Georgia (the Eastern European one) Louisiana, Hawaii, Mauritius and Seychelles. This TV series is dedicated to presenting history, culture and geography in a fun and pisitive way. It encourages people to explore this beautiful world - something that starts with simply getting out of town!

programme.title: Out Of Town Adventures
programme.desc: Outta Town Adventures travels both near and far to discover the best advenures the destinations have to offer. programme.title: Show Me Where You Live
programme.desc: Show me where you live is a documentary series that aims to answer the following question: How can human beings claim ownership to a space so that they can live safely within it, function as a society, and above all be in harmony with the environment around them? As we discover cultures and emblematic populations, we follow Philippe Simay who is at the heart of Inhabiting the World and represents its identity and originality. Philippe takes us on an epic adventure around the Human Habitat and sets the tone for the journey. As a humanist and philosopher, Philippe is a tireless surveyor of the city, and an explorer of living spaces. Determined to travel around the world, Philippe unveils how the populations that he encounters claim the space they occupy, shapes it and adjust to it. In this series of 20 films, of 26 minutes each, the habitat will be a major showcase revealing our capacity to adapt ourselves at a time where we need to find solutions in order to address immense changes.

programme.title: Show Me Where You Live

programme.title: Travel Quest
programme.desc: Bill Ball breaks the rules and stereo types of travel shows as he ventures beyond the highlights. What do you do after youve lead groups to over 140 countries and all 7 continents? Welcome to Bills bucket list on steroids... Travel Quest. This new, fast-paced series chases Bill around the globe as he seeks out anything but the mundane and ordinary—coming face-to-face with the largest crocodiles in the world, snorkeling with thousands of jellyfish, walking on the rim of an exploding volcano, feeding a group of sharks without a cage, bicycling across the Serengeti... this is not your typical travel show!

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: The night sky is a time machine. The further we look out into the universe the further back in time we reach. What we see in the night sky is only a small percentage of the contents of the Universe, most is dark matter and dark energy we know it exists; however its nature eludes us for the moment.

programme.title: The Great Journey
programme.desc: They manage to fly over the first hills of the Chilean mountain range, but fail and fall in a small town and must be rescued. Next to the pilot Cristian Millas we will fly in the Chilean precordillera, aboard a modern hot air balloon.

programme.title: Blue Realm
programme.desc: Tentacles follows Dr. Jennifer Mather as she leads a team of renowned scientists to the beautiful Caribbean island of Bonaire. Their mission is to prove a controversial theory: reef squid speak to each other with a complex language they paint on their skin. The episode features the bizarre courtship and never-before-filmed egg-laying rituals of reef squid. Travel to the Pacific Northwest for an encounter with the worlds largest Octopus. Youll also witness the fascinating hunting technique of the cuttlefish.

programme.title: Of Boats And Men
programme.desc: Travelling by boat bears a priceless sense of Freedom and offers endless new vistas to all passengers. Across waterways around the world Boats are an essential tool of daily life whether they carry goods, serve as utilities or services in remote areas.

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: Series introduction and the study of Earth from orbit. The sky above is littered with stars and countless galaxies. It is where we come from and where we are destined to return. The first phase of this journey is complete, now commences the second, with robotics, advanced technologies and sheer daring we are now going where before we only dreamt.

programme.title: Nomads Seeking Adventure
programme.desc: Nomads Seeking Adventure mixes the adrenaline rush of extreme sports with the adventure of travel. Showcasing the passion of some of the greatest extreme sports professionals from around the globe, episodes feature such stories as pro mountain bikers taking to the rocky mountain terrain of Mexicos Copper Canyon; an international team of kayakers tackling the white-water dangers of New Zealands south island; paragliding in the volcanic region of Mt. Teide on Tenerife in the Canary Islands; X games medalists travelling to the slopes of Haines, Alaska to face the challenges of heli-skiing; expert mountain bikers meeting up for five days of racing in Whistler, Canada.

programme.title: Nomads
programme.desc: Follow breathtaking travel adventures of some well known athletes of extreme sports. Have a look at some stunning locations in Alaska, Mexico, Argentina, Japan, Tahiti, Africa, Costa Rica, Norway, Hawaii and whitewater kayaking, extreme big mountain skiing, windsurfing, kiteboarding, extreme snowboarding and big wave surfing that push the limits of possibility. The focus is on compelling personalities and great storytelling.

programme.title: On the Cities Rooftops
programme.desc: How is life on the citys roofs? This series scales new heights, exploring apartment buildings, towers and monuments to discover a world full of unsuspected treasures : our rooftops. By day and night, the population changes on these heights. There are people who work here, people who live here, and others who come here to relax. The worlds rooftops are a continual hive of activity…

programme.title: Water: H2O Stories
programme.desc: Water: H2O Stories is a 3x52 series revisiting the story of water on planet Earth and its disrupted course over time which has led to the 21st century biggest challenge.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see, how we can live in space and what science tells us about the past and the future as we journey inside out of space.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see, how we can live in space and what science tells us about the past and the future as we journey inside out of space.

programme.title: Zenith - Advances In Space Exploration
programme.desc: Zenith - Advances in Space Exploration reveals these latest developments and the implications they hold for all of us.

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: The commercial space flight companies are edging closer and closer to flight readiness. Paying customers will soon be launching into space; tourists and their money is thought to be a major step forward into space and beyond. Blue Origin flight tests have been a great success and may launch commercial flights as soon as years end. Virgin Galactic is also smashing mile stones towards flight certification. SpaceX and its Manned Dragon capsule in direct competition with Boeings moves closer to an ISS taxi service.

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: The ESA - JAXA joint Bepi-Colombo Mission is moments away from launch. The target is Mercury which has been too long neglected; this mission will shed new light on this strange world of light and dark.

programme.title: Fragrance and Emotions
programme.desc: Unique documentary that takes you to discover the secret of some of the most luxurious perfumes and emblematic fragrances in the world. Visit the famous city of Grasse to meet the creators, the beautiful flower fields and all the incredible emotional powers of the Perfume.

programme.title: Depleted Uranium, A Very Presentable Killer
programme.desc: More than 50 countries now possess weapons based on depleted uranium (DU). Experimentation has been rife, and the consequences for civilians and the military alike have been dramatic. This investigation compares and contrasts the arguments of those who defend and attack a technology that is highly toxic. For 20 years, scientists, doctors, veterans and activists have denounced the use of DU. Against them are the arms industry lobbyists and nuclear authorities who continue to minimise the risks. Through archive documents, interviews and in situ investigations, accompanied by key witnesses (victims, experts...) we aim to present a clearer picture of the issues and stakes linked to the use of DU. Quick-paced, with a sense of urgency, the film underlines the essential background and conflicting viewpoints, enabling viewers to make up their own minds about a subject that concerns us all.

programme.title: Alien Invaders!
programme.desc: Alien Invaders is a documentary special that throws three young, but experienced, hosts into the world of invasive species of animals, fish, birds, insects, viruses and plants to create television mayhem. The show looks at invasions of aggressive non-indigenous animals around the world. Pacific lionfish are eating their way through the Caribbean, Burmese pythons are infesting the Everglades, African killer bees have worked their way north from Brazil to Utah, Asian carp are now swimming in the millions from New Orleans to Chicago. These and many other "alien invaders" are the villains (and stars!) of our show.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. At the heart of Africa, the Congo for many people will always be associated with Joseph Conrads early twentieth-century novel the Heart of Darkness, a title that has become a by-word for the country. And for Benjamin and David, two former child soldiers, and Funaha held as a sex slave by one of the many militias that continue to terrorise the country, that metaphor remains a daily reality. The film explores how this seemingly never-ending conflict impacts on the people of North Kivu.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: Music Voyager is a music and travel broadcast series (television/cable, broadband, in-flight and mobile) that invites viewers to discover the exciting sounds of the planet. The host is Jacob Edgar, an explorer who does not search for lost cities or ancient ruins. Hes on the quest for a different kind of treasure…music. As an ethnomusicologist and world music record producer, Edgar travels the globe hunting for the best songs the world has to offer, and he suffers through some of the worst…so you dont have to. Along the way, hes rewarded with a backstage pass to concert halls, street festivals, recording studios and rehearsal rooms. With local musicians as his guide, Edgar tastes exotic and occasionally ghastly food, visits off-the-beaten path attractions and parties the night away to amazing concerts at hidden venues that only the locals know. Join music voyager for unexpected adventures and surprising discoveries that unveil the magic, mystery and music of far off lands.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: Blackpool Pleasure Beach is one of the most visited attractions in the United Kingdom. People visit it not only for the fun, but to also hopefully catch a glimpse of the many ghosts that haunt there.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: The former home of Queen Victoria is now home to many spirits who have been seen by guests and staff. Witness the first ever formal documentation of the paranormal activities in the Bulkeley Hotel.

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: The R.I.P. Files features a group of paranormal investigators, who use intuitive abilities and a deep knowledge of metaphysical techniques to interact with the entities they encounter at haunted locations. They encourage the spirits to share their stories in their own words through amazing EVPs and other evidence that is bridging the gap between the worlds of science and spirituality.

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: The R.I.P. Files features a group of paranormal investigators, who use intuitive abilities and a deep knowledge of metaphysical techniques to interact with the entities they encounter at haunted locations. They encourage the spirits to share their stories in their own words through amazing EVPs and other evidence that is bridging the gap between the worlds of science and spirituality.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: Up, up and away! We discover St. Petersburg Floridas aviation roots at the St.Pete History Museum. Then, comb your mustache, we visit the Dali Museum to look at Salvador Dalis amazing masterworks. Well dredge the deep looking for sponges, and defend the bay at Fort Desoto.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: The Great Rift Valley is actually where the continent of Africa is literally tearing itself apart. Its a geologic phenomenon where one side is a rainforest full of colorful birds and strange monkeys and the other, a large lake centered on a vast plain. Two bordering eco-zones…double the wildlife.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: To this day sisal, a rope making fiber plant, is a mainstay of the economy. Journeys tours the capital city of Tanzania and its diverse religious institutions before heading into sisal country. Well learn about the German influences and the seldom heard story of Livingstones final trip across Africa.

programme.title: Everyday Elements
programme.desc: A series that puts chemistry in our everyday experience by showing the living connection we have with the chemicals and elements that make up our world. The matter that built skies and seas, the atoms that make up you and me, the chemistry around us that forms the things we touch, smell and see. This series shows us what the objects in our universe and in our homes are made from and why the particles around us behave as they do. Everything around us is built from Everyday Elements.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: Were exploring the other side New York state in Buffalo and Niagara. Well take the oath of office like Teddy, at the Roosevelt inauguration site in Buffalo. Then, well take a tour of the Frank Lloyd Wright Martin house and learn about Americas most celebrated architect. We get soaked on the Maid of the Mist at breathtaking Niagara Falls, and defend the walls at Fort Niagara.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: Get your sun tan lotion on, because were headed to the land of perfect weather and sunsets. Well sample a fish taco, climb the 100s of steps of the California Tower, stand on the flight deck of the USS Midway, as well as, revisit San Diegos founding on the San Salvador at the San Diego Maritime museum.

programme.title: Out Of Town Adventures
programme.desc: Outta Town Adventures travels both near and far to discover the best advenures the destinations have to offer. Season 1 visits attractions from California to Rwanda, Switzerland, Iceland, Utah, Zambia, Mexico, The Grand Canyon, Georgia (the Eastern European one) Louisiana, Hawaii, Mauritius and Seychelles. This TV series is dedicated to presenting history, culture and geography in a fun and pisitive way. It encourages people to explore this beautiful world - something that starts with simply getting out of town!

programme.title: Out Of Town Adventures
programme.desc: Outta Town Adventures travels both near and far to discover the best advenures the destinations have to offer. programme.title: Show Me Where You Live
programme.desc: Show me where you live is a documentary series that aims to answer the following question: How can human beings claim ownership to a space so that they can live safely within it, function as a society, and above all be in harmony with the environment around them? As we discover cultures and emblematic populations, we follow Philippe Simay who is at the heart of Inhabiting the World and represents its identity and originality. Philippe takes us on an epic adventure around the Human Habitat and sets the tone for the journey. As a humanist and philosopher, Philippe is a tireless surveyor of the city, and an explorer of living spaces. Determined to travel around the world, Philippe unveils how the populations that he encounters claim the space they occupy, shapes it and adjust to it. In this series of 20 films, of 26 minutes each, the habitat will be a major showcase revealing our capacity to adapt ourselves at a time where we need to find solutions in order to address immense changes.

programme.title: Show Me Where You Live

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: They orbit between us and our Star, the inner worlds; hidden within the suns glare often only visible at sunrise or sunset. Venus the first and brightest star in the evening sky, and Mercury fleeting across the solar disk. They are half of our solar systems terrestrial planets yet we know so little. As we begin to take a closer look at our companions they are posing more questions than answers.

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: It has fired our imaginations for millennia, Mars, the God of War and the source of Mans science fictional demise. We know the dry barren planet was once flowing with vast reservoirs of water, the sky thick and filled with clouds and the tantalizing possibility of life. It is the only other place in our solar system than Man might one day call home.

programme.title: On the Cities Rooftops
programme.desc: How is life on the citys roofs? This series scales new heights, exploring apartment buildings, towers and monuments to discover a world full of unsuspected treasures : our rooftops. By day and night, the population changes on these heights. There are people who work here, people who live here, and others who come here to relax. The worlds rooftops are a continual hive of activity…

programme.title: On the Cities Rooftops
programme.desc: How is life on the citys roofs? This series scales new heights, exploring apartment buildings, towers and monuments to discover a world full of unsuspected treasures : our rooftops. By day and night, the population changes on these heights. There are people who work here, people who live here, and others who come here to relax. programme.title: Wow, I Never Knew That!
programme.desc: Before computer drawing programs, there was a toy that if you mastered its two circular white knobs you could have a picture perfect SKETCH. Well explain how the ETCH A SKETCH drew onto the scene. And what did Neil Armstrong REALLY say when he stepped on the moon, the "aahh" answer will surprise you! Plus, where did the explosive name BIKINI come from?

programme.title: Wow, I Never Knew That!
programme.desc: It was the PURRRFECT idea for making our furry friends more pleasant around the house! Youll learn how KITTY LITTER clawed its way into our homes. And youll learn how a garment made out of special woven fibers can stop a bullet, plus, why is walking under a ladder bad luck? And finally, well CUT TO THE CHASE and explain the history behind this common phrase!

programme.title: Of Boats And Men
programme.desc: Travelling by boat bears a priceless sense of Freedom and offers endless new vistas to all passengers. Across waterways around the world Boats are an essential tool of daily life whether they carry goods, serve as utilities or services in remote areas.

programme.title: China Uncovered
programme.desc: Fashion designer Ji Cheng has shown her designs at London fashion week and, like beauty stylist A Zhi, is beginning to challenge the monopoly of Western brands in China. New levels of expendable income mean the wallets of the wealthy elite are helping fund this rising beauty scene and creating a market for luxury goods for shrewd businesswoman Felicity Feng. Expats from everywhere are trying to gain a foothold in this blossoming city, but can they handle its lightning speed?

programme.title: China Uncovered
programme.desc: Famous Chinese Erhu player Zhao Lei is leaving his stamp on classical Chinese music by experimenting with musical fusion between the East and West. On a sharper note in downtown Shanghai, Yuyintang Livehouse opens its doors to contemporary music lovers. The spiritual home of cutting edge beats in Shanghai, Yuyintang has started the careers of Visual Kei band Lilith and progressive metal rockers Mathlotus, but the modern music scene is still reeling from the Rock n Roll ban of the Cultural Revolution. Join them as they strive to become the rock stars of tomorrow.

programme.title: Brazils Coastlines
programme.desc: A series to celebrate Brazil and its diversity. We will explore the beauty and richness of the 8000 kilometer-long coasts, focusing on their natural and geographical aspects but also on its economic and cultural facets. An exciting journey blending the best aerial shots with stunning photography across the country to reveal both a cultural and human portrait.

programme.title: Dream Journey
programme.desc: February 2017 saw me embark upon a travel expedition through Scotland, Poland, France, Mexico, Belize and, (alas!), back. Not only was it the first time I ventured out to Central America, but also the first time I seriously pushed my bravery boundaries to do a whole lot of things Id never tried before. I defeated my life-long fear of scubadiving and skydiving, (the Carribbean vistas do help! - No danger Id do that again in Aberdeen), I went zip-lining over a Mexican jungle, I tried habanero-packed streetfood, (failed at that miserably), and organic tequila, (managed that better;), I climbed a Maya pyramid in the middle of a Belizean rainforest and fed hibiscus flowers to a very extravagant donkey. Most importantly, however, I got to know some incredible people - from shamans, wanderers and artists to refugees, businesswomen and expat cowboys. And thanks to aaaall of that, I also got to know a little bit more about myself for visiting the most remote corners of our planet reminds you how different and yet how similar we all are. Im looking forward to sharing my incredible experience in 5 exciting episodes of our travel series, which really turned out to be a Dream Journey:) I simply cannot wait for more!

programme.title: Race of Life
programme.desc: These are Natures own Battletanks, and (with the exception of the Indian Elephant), all endemic to the African continent. The African Savannah is the stage for thousands of battles every day. How do elephants, these large, cumbersome creatures survive and even prosper on a diet that even the strictest vegetarian would pass on! Well for one thing, most other animals get out of their way. But lions and hyenas are not always so easily moved – they prey on young, sick and old elephants in particular. This seemingly gentle giant has been revealed to have a darker side in the last few years too. They may survive on just plant life, but that doesnt mean they dont like a fight – to the death. Elephants have been observed attacking and killing Rhinos in the last 20 years. Its a savage clash. Meanwhile, the Rhino, a tough looking customer if ever there was one, is an endangered species. When the great herds go on the search for food, predators go on the hunt for them. If ever there was an animal that seems destined to survive, its the Rhino, which has been around for over 6 million years. But it too has an enemy: mankind – the deadliest foe of all. Then theres the hippopotamus. An adult hippo is a huge, aggressive animal, and even the largest crocodiles tend to stay away from it. However, when baby hippos stray from their mothers, then crocodiles, lions and hyenas will have a go if they can get away without being attacked themselves by adults in the baby hippos herd. Thats why baby hippos must stay close to Mum

programme.title: Race of Life
programme.desc: Males and females of most species will fight viciously in self-defense. And females, can be even more aggressive than males when defending their young. In this episode well explore the Race of Life from the point of view of food, territory, social status, and mates. Though some fights occur between two different species, most battles are fought between members of the same species. Though the wildlife warriors in these battles usually are not trying to kill each other, the fighting can result in death. Why would members of the same species fight with such ferocity? Food is one reason. Animals that store and horde food for survival will aggressively protect their pantries. Animals are also willing to fight to protect their food indirectly. For example, predators will defend a territory that provides them with enough prey, or food, to survive. This territorial aggression serves to space out members of a species across their range in a way that maintains sufficient food within each territory. But it also may limit population size. For example, if a pack of wolves cannot find, defend, or take over a suitable territory, the members may starve to death. Though food, territory, social status, and mates may be won and kept by fighting, aggression takes its toll. Animal combatants face exhaustion, injuries, time away from resting and eating, and the ultimate cost of battle: death. Thus, just like human beings, its often in an animals interest to win a war before it ever begins - or to avoid confrontation altogether.

programme.title: Meet My Wild Friend
programme.desc: Gasp at animal power, gawp at childhood innocence, this is the true story of children who live as friends with wild animals. The director of The First Cry, Gilles de Maistre has traveled the world in search of children who maintain unusual and special relationships with wild animals. With the strength of innocence, the power of raw faith and the magic of respect, these little princes have found the balance between two worlds in harmony with one another, where child and animal trust each other, learn to know one another, live together and love each other. Gasp at animal power, gawp at childhood innocence, this is the true story of children who live as friends with wild animals.

programme.title: A Dogs Life
programme.desc: A Dogs Life explores the widely assumed facts that may actually be based on faulty and out-dated research. Ingenious experiments and meticulous observation reveal that the problems dogs solve best are those that involve interacting with humans. A fascinating and fun documentary that gives us a dogs eye view on the world.

programme.title: Animal Doctors
programme.desc: Explore how animals developed over time and generations their own medicine and health care strategies. How have these been passed onto early humans ? Questioning traditional boundaries between human and animal, we will travel from Central African Republic, to Tanzania, from the US to France with the leading experts in animal behaviour. Todays science revisits the birth of animal intelligence and culture.

programme.title: Mongolia, Steppes Emirate
programme.desc: Battered by strong winds, and seen as a grazing land, Mongolia is the kingdom of steppes. With important mineral resources such as copper or uranium, coal and rare soil, Mongolia future is secure: the economy shows a significant growth rate and it is a business paradise for some expatriates. But for most of the population, needs remain unfulfilled.

programme.title: Duo Mix
programme.desc: Nakts programma ar mūzikas video dažādām gaumēm. Dejojiet, dziediet līdzi vai izbaudiet, guļot zem segas.

programme.title: Slepkavas motīvs
programme.desc: Populāra terapeite vienā dienā ir pilnīgi vesela, bet jau nākamajā nomirst sāpīgā nāvē. Kad ārsti atklāj viņas nāves iemeslu, kas nav dabīgs, policijai jāsāk meklēt, kurš un kāpēc vēlējās šīs sievietes nāvi.

programme.title: Ņujorkas slepkavība
programme.desc: Masu apšaudē Čelsijā ir viens bojāgājušais un trīs ievainotie. Izmeklētāji atklāj, ka šī ir jaunākā slepkavību sērija, kas aptver vairākus iecirkņus. Izmeklētāji nonāk Ņujorkas pazemes pasaulē.

programme.title: Pirmās 48 stundas
programme.desc: Pirmās 48 stundas pēc nozieguma izdarīšanas izmeklētāju darbā ir visbūtiskākās, jo tieši šis laikposms nereti izšķir to, vai noziegums tiks atšķetināts. Vēlāk izmeklētāju izredzes notvert vainīgo sarūk uz pusi. Raidījums ļauj ielūkoties ASV slepkavību izmeklētāju ikdienā, kuri neatlaidīgi strādā, lai jau pirmajās nozieguma izdarīšanas stundās atklātu pēc iespējas vairāk detaļu par ļaunprātības apstākļiem. Skatītājus sagaida reāls izmeklēšanas process, liecinieku intervijas, kriminālistiskās ekspertīzes aizkulises un iespēja ielūkoties vietās, kur nupat pastrādāts noziegums.

programme.title: Vanity Fair: Konfidencionāli
programme.desc: "Stocking Strangler" sērijveida slepkavas medības Kolumbusā beigu beigās noved pie Karltona Gerija aresta un notiesāšanas. Šaubas par viņa vainu rodas vairākus gadus vēlāk.

programme.title: Slepkavas motīvs
programme.desc: Populāra terapeite vienā dienā ir pilnīgi vesela, bet jau nākamajā nomirst sāpīgā nāvē. Kad ārsti atklāj viņas nāves iemeslu, kas nav dabīgs, policijai jāsāk meklēt, kurš un kāpēc vēlējās šīs sievietes nāvi.

programme.title: Ņujorkas slepkavība
programme.desc: Masu apšaudē Čelsijā ir viens bojāgājušais un trīs ievainotie. Izmeklētāji atklāj, ka šī ir jaunākā slepkavību sērija, kas aptver vairākus iecirkņus. Izmeklētāji nonāk Ņujorkas pazemes pasaulē.

programme.title: Pirmās 48 stundas
programme.desc: Pirmās 48 stundas pēc nozieguma izdarīšanas izmeklētāju darbā ir visbūtiskākās, jo tieši šis laikposms nereti izšķir to, vai noziegums tiks atšķetināts. Vēlāk izmeklētāju izredzes notvert vainīgo sarūk uz pusi. Raidījums ļauj ielūkoties ASV slepkavību izmeklētāju ikdienā, kuri neatlaidīgi strādā, lai jau pirmajās nozieguma izdarīšanas stundās atklātu pēc iespējas vairāk detaļu par ļaunprātības apstākļiem. Skatītājus sagaida reāls izmeklēšanas process, liecinieku intervijas, kriminālistiskās ekspertīzes aizkulises un iespēja ielūkoties vietās, kur nupat pastrādāts noziegums.

programme.title: Vanity Fair: Konfidencionāli
programme.desc: "Stocking Strangler" sērijveida slepkavas medības Kolumbusā beigu beigās noved pie Karltona Gerija aresta un notiesāšanas. Šaubas par viņa vainu rodas vairākus gadus vēlāk.

programme.title: Pazudis
programme.desc: 21 gadu vecā Kortne Stoufere kādā nakrī pazūd no savas gultas. Izmeklētāji pārbauda dažādus pavedienus un versijas, bet jaunā skaistule nekur nav atrodama. Viņas ģimene turpina bezgalīgi cerēt uz labāko.

programme.title: Slepkavība, noslēpumi un mana ģimene
programme.desc: Advokāti atkārtoti izskata izmeklēšanu saistībā ar aprūpes nama iemītnieka saindēšanos Notingemā 1935. gadā, par ko upura medmāsa tika notiesāta un pakārta.

programme.title: Slepkavas motīvs
programme.desc: Kad Luiziānā tiek atrasts apdrošināšanas brokera Braiena Deivisa līķis, policija atklāj, ka viņš bija cilvēks ar noslēpumainu dzīvi. Vai viņa tuvākie varētu slēpt līdz šim lielāko mirušā noslēpumu?

programme.title: Ņujorkas slepkavība
programme.desc: Ņujorkas policijas izmeklētāji sacenšas, lai atklātu dīvaino savējā slepkavību, pirms viltīgais slepkava izslīd no valsts.

programme.title: Pirmās 48 stundas

programme.title: Vanity Fair: Konfidencionāli
programme.desc: No elitārās koledžas pilsētas pazūd divas sievietes. Sabiedrību pārņem panika -- ir atrasti viņu ķermeņi. Kādus ļaunus noslēpumus policija atklās, divām ģimenēm mudinot sabiedrību palīdzēt slepkavas meklēšanā un notiesāšanā?

programme.title: Pazudis

programme.title: Vanity Fair: Konfidencionāli
programme.desc: "Zelta zēns", zvaigžņu sportists, Darienas vidusskolas vecākais, apsūdzēts par divu vietējo vidusskolnieču izvarošanu. Viņš neierodas tiesā un izvairās no FIB un Interpola, cenšoties izbēgt no tiesas.

programme.title: Vanity Fair: Konfidencionāli
programme.desc: 1980. gada pavasarī un vasarā Losandželosā stiro sērijveida slepkavas, kas nolaupa sievietes un atstāj viņu ķermeņus neparastās vietās.

programme.title: Slepkavība brīvdienās
programme.desc: Reaģējot uz laupīšanu sporta preču veikalā Ziemassvētku vakarā, Teksasas štata Ērvingas pilsētas policists tiek aukstasinīgi nošauts. Tiek atklāta slepkavu identitāte, un lieta pārvēršas valsts mēroga medībās.

programme.title: Slepkavība brīvdienās
programme.desc: Koledžas studente atrasta mirusi ceļa malā pēc Jaungada ballītes viņas dzimtajā pilsētā Fillmorā, Kalifornijā. Izmeklētāji kā vienu no iespējām izskata, ka slepkava varētu būt viens no daudzajiem ballīšu apmeklētājiem, kas sagaidīja Jauno gadu.

programme.title: Pazudis
programme.desc: Sieva, māte un bībeles skolotāja Lina Mesere pazudusi no ģimenes fermas netālu no Seintdženevīvas Misuri. Viņas divi dēli, divas māsas, vietējais šerifs un pat visa komūna izmisīgi meklē viņu vairāk nekā divus gadus. Bet tad..

programme.title: Slepkavība, noslēpumi un mana ģimene
programme.desc: Advokāti Džeremijs Deins un Saša Vasa atskatās uz savu izmeklēšanu par vīrieša slepeno saindēšanu, ko viņa sieva 1930. gados Linkolnšīrā veica, un ko atklāja anonīma piezīme.

programme.title: Slepkavība, noslēpumi un mana ģimene
programme.desc: Advokāti Džeremijs Deins un Saša Vasa atskatās uz lietu, kas ir dīvaināka nekā izdomājums: Džons Dikmens tika pakārts Ņūkāslas cietumā par Džona Nisbeta slepkavību vilcienā.

programme.title: Slepkavas motīvs
programme.desc: Kad Kalifornijā pazūd četru cilvēku, tostarp divu mazu bērnu, ģimene, policija uzskata, ka viņi aizbēguši. Paiet desmitgade līdz atklājas - viņus nogalinājis slepkava, kas nozieguma brīdī nemaz nebija slēpies.

programme.title: Slepkavas motīvs
programme.desc: Armijnieks tiek nošauts kādā Kalifornijas tuksneša mazpilsētā. Izmeklēšana pārbauda draudzības saiknes un ģimenes lojalitāti, cenšoties atrast slepkavu.

programme.title: Slepkavas motīvs
programme.desc: Radio personība un veterānu aizstāve tiek nošauta pašas guļamistabā. Vai viņas skaļā viedokļa paušana bija iemesls šim noziegumam vai tomēr viņas ģimene slēpj pēdas līdz slepkavai?

programme.title: Ņujorkas slepkavība
programme.desc: Pēc mīļota Kvīnsas geja brutālās slepkavības kopiena sapulcējas, kamēr Ņujorkas policijas izmeklētāji slepenā misijā medī slepkavas.

programme.title: Ņujorkas slepkavība
programme.desc: Austrumhārlemā ikviens pazina Džeisonu Adamsu. Kad viņš tiek atrasts nodurts, pārbiedētajai sabiedrībai rodas tikai viens jautājums - kurš gan varēja vēlēties viņa nāvi? Izmeklētāji ir satriekti, un tikai negaidīta avota padoms palīdz sākt šķetināt šo slepkavību.

programme.title: Duo Mix
programme.desc: Nakts programma ar mūzikas video dažādām gaumēm. Dejojiet, dziediet līdzi vai izbaudiet, guļot zem segas.

programme.title: Kailā pievilcība
programme.desc: Savdabīgs randiņu šovs, kurā cilvēki līdz ar mīlas peripetijām iepazīstas ar pakāpeniski atkalinātiem ķermeņiem. Pēcāk jāizģērbjas arī viņiem pašiem un jāizvēlas.

programme.title: Divarpus vīri
programme.desc: Divi brāļi nevarētu būt dažādāk –: Čārlijam ir viss, ko dzīvē var vēlēties: nauda, skaista māja okeāna piekrastē, pavisam nedaudz darāmā un neskaitāmas draudzenes. Turpretī Alans ir īsts neveiksminieks – no viņa ir izšķīrusies sieva, kura ir paturējusi sev abu kopīgi iegādāto māju, un Alans nespēj savilkt kopā galus, lai samaksātu rēķinus. Tā kā Alanam nav pa kabatai atļauties savu mājokli, viņš lūdz Čārlijam atļauju padzīvot pie viņa kādu laiciņu, kamēr apradīs ar jauno situāciju un atradīs pats savu mājvietu. Viņi pat nenojauta, uz cik ilgu laiku tas ievilksies un cik daudz jautrības tas sagādās skatītājiem.

programme.title: Divarpus vīri
programme.desc: Divi brāļi nevarētu būt dažādāk –: Čārlijam ir viss, ko dzīvē var vēlēties: nauda, skaista māja okeāna piekrastē, pavisam nedaudz darāmā un neskaitāmas draudzenes. Viņi pat nenojauta, uz cik ilgu laiku tas ievilksies un cik daudz jautrības tas sagādās skatītājiem.

programme.title: Mani sauc Erls
programme.desc: Erls atved narkomānam gaisa kondicionieri, ko bija no viņa nozadzis, un nedēļu nodzīvo komūnā. Šī pieredze liek viņam sākt domāt par vidi, kas rada lielu stresu.

programme.title: Mani sauc Erls
programme.desc: Erls mēģina padarīt Keniju vīrišķīgāku, bet tā vietā padara viņus abus atkarīgus no azartspēlēm. Viņa atkarība izraisa Katalīnas deportāciju, pirms Rendijs paspēj viņai atzīties jūtās.

programme.title: Pidurdunud areng
programme.desc: Policija mēģina Maiklu vainot Kitijas pazušanā. Savukārt Maikls ņem līdzi Meibiju uz pasākumu "Aizved meitu uz darbu".

programme.title: Pidurdunud areng
programme.desc: Maikls atklāj noslēpumu, kas slēpjas aiz tēva finansiālajām problēmām. Džordžs vecākais cietumā piedzīvo sirdslēkmi, un viņam izdodas izbēgt no slimnīcas.

programme.title: Mani sauc Erls
programme.desc: Erls atved narkomānam gaisa kondicionieri, ko bija no viņa nozadzis, un nedēļu nodzīvo komūnā. Šī pieredze liek viņam sākt domāt par vidi, kas rada lielu stresu.

programme.title: Mani sauc Erls
programme.desc: Erls mēģina padarīt Keniju vīrišķīgāku, bet tā vietā padara viņus abus atkarīgus no azartspēlēm. Viņa atkarība izraisa Katalīnas deportāciju, pirms Rendijs paspēj viņai atzīties jūtās.

programme.title: Ofiss
programme.desc: Ofisā, kura darbinieki nodarbojas ar papīra pārdošanu un piegādi, viss ir tāpat kā lielākajā daļā pasaules ofisu - tajā ir boss, tajā ir dažādi darbinieki, no kuriem dažs labs vien darbu tikai imitē, un starp visiem izveidojušās ofisa attiecības tādā kā piespiedu kārtā - labākas un arī ne tik labas. Kā jau ar kolēģiem. Ofisa vadītājs Maikls, kuru attēlo slavenais aktieris un komiķis Stīvs Karels, savus darbiniekus ik dienas cenšas iesaistīt savos izgudrotajos jokos un uzdevumos. Viņš pats domā, ka ir pasaules labākais boss, ko apliecina krūzīte ar uzrakstu - "Pasaules labākais boss". Diemžēl šo krūzīti viņš sev nopircis pats. Maikls cenšas būt draudzīgs pret saviem darbiniekiem, tomēr lielākā daļa viņa joku ir rasistiski, šovinistiski vai citādi aizskaroši.

programme.title: Ofiss
programme.desc: Ofisā, kura darbinieki nodarbojas ar papīra pārdošanu un piegādi, viss ir tāpat kā lielākajā daļā pasaules ofisu - tajā ir boss, tajā ir dažādi darbinieki, no kuriem dažs labs vien darbu tikai imitē, un starp visiem izveidojušās ofisa attiecības tādā kā piespiedu kārtā - labākas un arī ne tik labas.
